decision_conditions: The proposal, by reason of the scale, appearance and siting of the banner advertisement frames, would be visually intrusive features within the streetscene, detrimental to the visual amenity created by the existing soft landscaping to the site frontage, and giving rise to an unacceptable degree of advertising clutter, to the detriment of local amenity and contrary to the provisions of Policy DC65 of the Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy and following confirmation the applicant required the proposals determined as submitted, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to Alexandra Burkart of Imagetechnique by email dated 30th July 2019.
description: 2 No. freestanding non illuminated banner frames
